title: Adjusting for Arctic Distance Misjudgment
brief: How to account for the tendency to underestimate distances in clear arctic air.
steps: Step 1: Recognize that clear arctic air makes objects appear closer than they actually are.
Step 2: When estimating travel time or distance, assume your first estimate is too short.
Step 3: Add 50-100% more time/distance to your initial estimates.
Step 4: Use known reference objects to help calibrate distance judgments when possible.
warnings: Underestimating distances can lead to being caught in the open without shelter.
Poor distance judgment can result in inadequate food/water planning for travel.
